review_blob: Pours a slightly hazy burnt orange color, with one finger of head that lasts a while, with good lacing. the aroma has lots going on, citrus hops, earthy hops, clove, maybe black licorice, along with sweet light to medium roasted malts. the taste is well balanced, a powerful hop presence, lots of spices, clove, honey, licorice, citrus, and other earthy notes. overall, this is a floral hop IPA, that is well balanced with citrus hops and a good malt backbone.

Pours a light golden yellow, with one finger of head. smells of fresh citrus, and earthy pine hops, not much malt on the nose, but its there. the taste is of grapefruit, lemon, spicy and earthy hops. again, its hard to pick up on a lot of malt characters, its there, but barely. nice fresh hop bitterness on the finish. overall, this is a great, hoppy, double IPA.

Pours a dark mahogany color with about half a finger of light brown head. looks and smells appealing during the pour. the aroma is of deep dark roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, very slight dark fruit character. great hop aroma as well. the taste is great on this one, wonderful dark roasted backbone with a well balanced addition of hops. other flavors are chocolate, coffee, dark fruits. overall, i was very pleased with this beer, lots of well balanced flavors that were easy to pick up, and not one flavor overpowered another, great brew!

Pours a golden yellow color with one finger of white head. the aroma is fruity, spicy, and a slight yeast note that Im picking up. light alcohol presence. the taste has grapefruit, a sweet and spicy yeast character. light malt backbone, slight presence of alcohol and a nice bitter finish. overall, this is a fresh and crisp IPA, if it was a blind taste test for me, i would have said it just an IPA, not an imperial. it needed more hop character.

pours a clear light golden amber color, one finger of a light off white head. bubbles last a while, with great lacing. smell is bready and caramel malts, earthy and slightly citrus hops. i get a bit of lemon. the taste is perfectly balanced, and bittered IPA. more of an east coast style with a lemon flavor. the bitterness lasts a while. overall, a great well balanced IPA.

pours a light, clear, lemon color, with one finger of head. great lacing. smell is of lemon, pine, and coriander. smells great! the taste is very well balanced. crisp lemon and citrus hops, with a little spice as well. good balance of light malts. great bitter and flavorful finish. overall, this is one of the best pills ive ever tried.

pours a light maple gold color, one and a half fingers of head. clear. smell is of lightly roasted malts, earthy hops, with some citrus and pine. the taste is of grapefruit, pine, sweet caramel malts. a moderate bitter and spicy finish. overall, a well balanced IPA.

pours a burnt lemon to light orange color with two fingers of head. the beer is hazy. smells of citrus, pine, earthy hops, with a light caramel aroma. the taste is crisp and refreshing, again, citrus and pine hop flavors, with a nice earthy quality to it. sweet malts with a slight bitterness. overall, this is almost a sessionable IPA, very drinkable, and crisp, but not really a great IPA.

pours a dark lemon color with a small amount of white foamy head, light carbonation. aroma is of sweet caramel malts, and earthy hops, and slight yeast notes. the taste is of the same flavors, earthy and spicy hops, you can taste the flavors from the yeast. and the beer fades with a decent bitterness. overall, this is a refreshing take on an english style IPA, very drinkable, but not really my thing.

pours a clear golden orange, with one finger of head. once i popped the bottle, this beer made my mouth water! aroma is of......HOPS!!! citrus, pine, grapefruit, bread malt backbone, smells very inviting! the taste is more refreshing than i expected out of a 100+ IBU beer! lots of astringency, grapefruit, orange, lemon, and pine. along with a decent light and sweet caramel malt backbone. quite bitter, but not till it finishes. without taking another sip, this beer remains bitter on the palate for at least 5 minuets. which is awesome!! overall, this is a beer that changed the way IPAs are made, especially on the west coast. CHEERS!!!

pours a hazy dark tangerine color. lots of white head, about two fingers. good lacing that lasts a while. the aroma is of grapefruit, pine, orange, lemon, light sweet malt bill. just the right amount of both. the taste is citrus and pine at the front, then light caramel malts in the middle of the mouth. with a citrus and pine bitter finish. overall, a very drinkable, well balanced and refreshing IPA.
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2013

Pours a nearly black deep mahogany color. One finger of a brown sugar colored head that dissipates quick. No lacing. Aroma is packed full of coffee! A hint of cocoa, dark roasted malts, and I also get dark fruits in this beer, cherries and raisins. The taste is a lot like the aroma, with the addition of as meet malt flavor, as well as the dark roasted ones. The finish is dry and bitter, with lingering flavors of hops, and coffee. Overall, I thought this beer was more of a coffee porter or stout. It needed more cocoa flavor. But it was a great beer!

pours a deep dark mahogany. one finger creamy light brown head. dissipates quickly. aroma, is dark roast coffee, dark roasted malts, and a very slight hop note. no smell of alcohol. the taste is a delicious coffee flavor, with roasted malts. again, no taste of alcohol, and a slight hop note. the beer finishes smooth and dry, with some bitterness from the coffee. overall, if you like dark strong coffee, this beer is for you!

pours a burnt orange red color, with one finger of head. aromas are full of dark fruits including dates, figs, raisins, also some toffee and other sweet malts. the taste is of dark fruits, now i get cherries, figs, raisins, and a slight nuttiness. finishes clean and smooth with very good drinkability. overall, this is a great brew from my home town!

pours a perfect golden hue, with a slight haze, and one finger of white head. aroma is of earthy hops, and floral notes, sweet light malt notes, maybe some pine and spruce as well. taste is well balanced, again, earthy and pine flavors, crisp and refreshing, slight pine and light roasted malt flavor on the finish. overall, great earthy hopped IPA, crisp and refreshing. more of an east coast style IPA.
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2013

This may be my favorite IPA yet!
appearance is a crystal clear yellowish gold color. one finger of white head, dissipates moderately. Aroma is AMAZING! lots and lots of citrus, i get pineapple, grapefruit, candied tropical fruit, pine notes, and a balance of light caramel malts. the tastes is very similar to the aroma, citrus & tropical bomb!! pineapple, grapefruit, pine, spruce, light caramel malt, and a hint of alcohol. the finish has a slight citrus and pine flavor that lingers. overall, this is an exceptional west coast style IPA that i will seek out and buy!

Pours a clear and crisp light gold, with one finger of head that dissipates quickly. Smells of sweet malts, crisp slightly citrusy hops, appears to be very well balanced. Taste is very similar to the smell. I get sweet malts with earthy citrusy hops. The alcohol is hidden very well. Very well balanced. Overall, this is a very drinkable IPA, tastes almost sessionable. Great IPA that I would buy again!

Pours a hazy light golden color, with one finger of head that lasts a while, and leaves good lacing. Smells of grapefruit, tangerine, orange zest. Light aroma of lightly toasted malts. The taste starts off with a peppery grapefruit flavor. Then you get tangerine and orange zest. Middle of the mouth you get light malt flavors. And the beer ends with grapefruit and pine notes. Overall, this is a really fresh and drinkable IPA. I would buy it again!

pours a hazy golden orange color, with only a half finger of white head, that dissipates quickly. smells of orange citrus, tangerine, pine, and a light malt character. taste is citrus, including orange peel and tangerine, some pine resin that lingers, i can taste the alcohol. overall, this is a strong west coast style IPA, i think they could have balanced the beer a little ore with the addition of more malt, and maybe different types of hops. i would buy it again.

pours black, but when held to light, a deep mahogany shows through. a decent one finger of light brown head. smells of dark heavily roasted malts, dark fruits (raisins), American hops, and a slight smell of alcohol. the taste is a well balanced fight between roasted malts and hops. which is a little different for this beer style(Russian imperial stout), again i get dark fruits, and only a little caramel sweetness. this beer has a dry hoppy finish. and the alcohol is there, but not overpowering. overall, this is an ever changing beer, that is a great American imperial stout!

Pours a dark cherry brown color, with one finger of head. The aroma is sweet, with dark fruits and raisins. Lots of roasted malts and barley. The taste starts off with more sweet dark fruit flavor and caramel. Then the middle of the mouth you get slot of roasted flavors. It ends with a pleasant but not overpowering hop bitterness. Overall, this is a decent brown ale that I have had before, and will have again!

Pours a dark honey color, with a two finger head. Aroma is quite malty, with and American style hop character. I'm smelling more malt than I would like. I think it lacks hops. Taste is the same as the smell. Quite a bit of malt, and not enough hops. Overall, it's an ok beer that I would pass by next time.

Pours a nice light golden ale color. Smells of strong pepper aromas! Not a lot of hop or malt notes. Taste is pretty hot! The only way I can describe it is if you chewed on a jalapeo, the took a taste of an ordinary ale. Overall, not too impressed with this beer. I think it could have been done better, and had more balance and flavors going for it.

Pours a hazy deep orange color with a decent amount of head that dissipates quickly. To be expected from 8.5% ABV. Aroma smells of roasted fruits. And alcohol. Orange and tangerine. I also get a lot of sweetness from the malts. Taste up front I get a sweet malt character, and a great resiny hop flavor. Again, I get a strong roasted fruit like burn from the alcohol, they didn't hide it very well in this beer. Overall, it's a good DIPA. But I've had much better.

Pours a nice maple color with less than a full finger of head. Aroma is of roasted malts, caramel, raisins, minimal hops, and a slight smell of alcohol. Taste is kinda bland, it's refreshing, but boring. Almost tastes like a watered down Octoberfest. Overall, I'm glad I tried it, but I won't buy this one again.

Pours a very dark and thick black. With a decent beige head. Aroma of dark malts, chocolate, coffee, dark fruits. You can't smell a lot of hops in the nose, but you can smell some alcohol heat. The taste is really great, a perfect balance of malt flavor, hops, and a bitter finish. The smooth mouthfeel from the oats is great too! Overall, this may be the best oatmeal stout I've ever had!
beer_name: Ballast Point Sea Monster Imperial Stout

review_blob: Pours a hazy orange tint with a decent one and a half finger of head. Aroma is of orange, citrus, caramel, and a decent hop profile. Tastes of citrusy hops, light malts, and is a very well balanced beer. I'm not sure if there is anything "brutal" about this IPA, it seems kind of ordinary to me. But not in a bad way. It's a perfect well done IPA! Update: as the beer warms up, more malts show through, and the hops fade.
beer_name: Rogue Nation Brutal India Pale Ale

review_blob: Pours a thick black with about one finger of head that dissipates slowly. Aroma is intense! Lots of spicy notes, coconut, a hint of lime. The taste is also very strong! A little too intense for my liking. The curry and cayenne heat that comes in on the finish is intense. Overall, I appreciate the complex brewing that this beer takes to make!
UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013

Pours a very deep rich red color, almost black. A decent one to two fingers of head, that has a caramel color. Lots of bubbles. Aroma has a lot of hop! And you have to look hard for the malts. Which I don't mind. Tastes of roasted malts, dark fruits, and strong hops. Overall, it reminds me more of a double IPA. But this is a great beer for hop heads!

Pours a clear golden orange color, with a one to two fingers of head. Leaves great lacing on the glass. Smells of citrus and centennial hops. Maybe grapefruit and candied fruit. Taste of citrus, and tropical fruit, but a decent malt bill to balance everything. A good amount of bitterness. Overall, it's a great medium bodied citrus IPA! One of my go to IPA's!!

Pours a dark red with minimal head. The head disappears quickly but leaves good lacing. Aroma is of dark malts, dark fruits, and minimal hops. Tastes smooth, with a fruity malt flavor. You can taste a little heat from the alcohol on the finish. Overall, it's a good beer that I would buy again!

Pours a lite golden color with one finger of white head. Smells of citrus, pine, and floral notes. Taste is citrus and pine. With just enough malt to balance everything. I taste a little heat from the alcohol. Overall, I enjoyed this beer and have yet to be disappointed by Ballast Point!!
beer_name: Ballast Point Fathom India Pale Lager

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Not impressed with this beer, it tastes more like a pilsner with fresh hops added. No malt balance, and the hop flavor is very resiny. Not impressed...
beer_name: Port Brewing High Tide  Fresh Hop IPA

review_blob:
Serving type: 22 oz bottle
A: pours a copper orange color with a decent amount of head. Great lacing too!
S: grassy and citrus notes, along with some pine. Smells really inviting as it should being a fresh hop ale.
T: it is a very clean tasting beer, that finishes smooth. There is no resiny aftertaste. It has a pleasant fresh grass and citrus flavor profile, with a slight malt backbone.
O: a very fresh tasting pale ale that I would buy again!
beer_name: Great Divide Fresh Hop Pale Ale

review_blob:
Serving type: bottle
A: translucent honey gold cold color, one finger head, with good lacing.
S: hop forward with pine, citrus, grapefruit, and a hint of mint. 
T: a sweet crackery and honey malt flavor gives way to the hops. Lemon, grapefruit, with a minty floral note.
O: a decent IPA, nothing wrong with it, just nothing amazing here.

Serving type: bottle
A: pours a copper & orange color that I found very appealing. A one to two finger head that last a while with good lacing. 
S: piney citrus flavors for sure, with some roasted malt to balance it out.
T: again, I get a lot of pine and citrus flavors that really work with this brew. with a bready malt backbone. A little resin flavor to.
O: I loved this beer, I think it's a great autumn / winter style IPA! This beer will be retuning to my fridge in years to come!

Serving type: Bottle
A: pours an orange and tangerine color. unfiltered , with a one finger head.
S: lots of floral notes, not much malt. And maybe some lemon zest. 
T: it taste better than it smells. Floral citrus type taste. With some zest added in as it lingers.
O: nothing too special in my book. It's a pretty cool unfiltered IPA. But nothing jumps out at me to impress me and make it great.
I would buy it again for its drink ability.

Serving type: Bottle
A: a very gorgeous hazy amber. One finger head, with small head retention.
S: lots of citrus and floral notes. I get a littles pine as well. Well balanced malt as well.
T: strong hop flavor hear that lingers afterwards. Again, a lot of citrus and resiny pine flavors.
O: after reading and hearing a lot about this beer, I find myself in agreement with the hype! Great beer, and I will definitely buy this beer again!
UPDATED: DEC 1, 2013
